Premier League Predictions 2015/16

By James Bithell

The Nouse Sport Team make their predictions for the upcoming Premier League season, which begins this weekend

York secure Team Cup semi-final place

The University of York played out a thriller against Knavesmire, eventually edging them out 4-3 to reach the semi-final of the team cup

James edge tense Cup final

A solitary goal was enough for James to claim the College Cup against Vanbrugh

Derwent Seconds win the Plate

Derwent Seconds earn Plate glory after beating Derwent Firsts 4-2 on penalties

College Cup Finals Day: As it happened

Take a look back at the College Cup Finals Day action as it happened

Que sera, sera

In Jamie Summers' final piece for Nouse (probably), he reflects on his time at the University and his love affair with Tom Fennelly

James firsts survive seconds scare

James firsts came back from a goal down to secure safe passage to the College Cup Final where they face Vanbrugh firsts

Dramatic all-James quarter final favours Seconds

In the most dramatic climax of the College Cup so far, James Seconds squeaked past James Thirds on penalties to reach the semi-finals

Firsts narrowly avoid defeat in Vanbrugh Derby

The Vanbrugh Derby went all the way to penalties, with the Firsts eventually coming out on top, booking their place in the semi-finals

Derwent Firsts score nine in derby win

Derwent Firsts secure a Plate semi final place after Josh Bew's six goals help his side to a 9-1 win over Derwent Fourths

Derwent rally to progress into Plate semi-finals

Derwent Fifths continued their impressive form as they came from behind to beat Alcuin Seconds and secure their place in the Plate semi-finals

Constantine unlucky in defeat against Derwent

A late onslaught from Derwent gave them the win against Constantine, whose performance was not reflected in the result

Alcuin wear down Wentworth resistance

In the quarter-finals of the Plate, Alcuin Firsts saw their class eventually pay dividends in a 4-1 victory over Wentworth Firsts

The Trewartha show seals James' safe passage

In the College Vase quarter-finals, James Fourths beat Halifax Fourths 4-2 on penalties thanks to some outstanding goalkeeping from stand-in Matthew Trewartha

'Fax fell Alcuin in cagey affair

Halifax thirds edged past Alcuin thirds in a tense encounter, an own-goal proving the difference

Langwith ease past lacklustre Vanbrugh

Langwith thirds scored a goal in each half against a Vanbrugh thirds side that never hit top form

York crowned Kingfisher White Rose Champions

York made the most of Hull's poor fielding to post an unassailable score and win the Kingfisher White Rose Trophy for a second year, after UYAFC won the 10-over tournament

Derwent win to secure Vase semi-final place

A solitary goal was enough to ensure Derwent Thirds a place in the semi-finals of the Vase tournament

York felled in final home game

New College Football season awaits

The College Football leagues get underway this week, as changes whet the appetite for an exciting season
